results.title: Eclair. Episode 03
results.creator_credit: ILEA, David Ash, Alma Gray and Pat McLagan
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme of this film is: “Food and drink - Asking for food and drinks in a cafe or restaurant” using names of food and drinks, and expression of hunger, thirst, likes and dislikes.

results.title: Echoes that remain
results.creator_credit: Arnold Schwartzman, Marvin Hier and Simon Wiesenthal Centre
results.brief_description: Martin Landau and Miriam Margolyes narrate “Echoes that remain” a moving documentary about the people of the shtetl and their lives before the Holocaust. Director Arnold Schwartzman combines past and present as archival footage is intercut with live action sequences filmed at the sites of former Jewish communities in Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland and Romania. The production crew’s research and admiration for the subject matter is evident and echoes of the film will remain with the viewer. Presented by one of America’s leading Jewish cultural institutions, the Simon Wiesenthal Centre. Music performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: Echinoderms: sea stars and their relatives
results.brief_description:
Episode of series “Biology program. Unit 3. Animal life”
Describes the characteristics of the echinoderm body plan and shows how it adapted for locomotion, respiration, digestion and reproduction. Includes examples of the five classes of echinodeerms.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Echidna
results.brief_description: This unique animal’s story is told in this film. Its place in the Australian fauna is established when it is shown how it is related to the platypus and the marsupials. Points out how the echidna differs from other members of the porcupine family and how this species respresents a link with past ages. Indicates why this species has survived and includes sequences on its appearance, food, distribution and habitat. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: ECCOS
results.brief_description:
Andrew Norman Wilson is the mastermind behind “ECCOS” — a “six-hour meditation video” featuring slowed-down footage of a gamer beating Ecco the Dolphin on Sega Genesis. Wilson produced the work from an 80-minute clip, to which he added echo filters for both audio and video tracks. The result is nothing short of haunting — a swirling, psychedelic, and slightly ominous collection of pixelated creatures and seascapes, scored to a persistent low hum.

ECCOS is just one part of Wilson’s “Center for Wave Change” — a proposed “experimental philosophical space that focuses on the phenomena of waves.”

Amar Toor, The Verge, 24/05/12

constellations_other.name: The dolphin Constellation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation echoes representations of dolphins across screen media.

results.title: EC, Poss & Kim
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Mario Andreacchio, Colin Budds, Steve Steve Jodrell, Australian Children's Television Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories from the popular series about the doll, EC and the two little girls, Poss and Kim. “Going under”: Kim is pushed under at the pool and is helped to face her fear of water. “Fun Day”: Poss and Kim have tickets to the fun park. “Growing up”: Kim overcomes her fears at the gym. “True friend”: Poss comes to understand true friendship.

results.title: EC, Nipper and Aku
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Steve Steve Jodrell and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Nipper and Aku are great friends. They share a world of fun and imagination, and they share EC as well! ‘Cherry Pie’ - Nipper, Aku, Paul and Poss visit Grandma’s and Grandpa’s farm. They go on a treasure hunt and are treated to Grandpa’s cherry pie. ‘Aku and the Dinosaur’ - Aku pretends to be a dinosaur, but she upsets her friends when she goes too far. ‘EC belongs to everybody’ - Nipper locks EC away and won’t let Aku play with the doll. But when he finds out that he’s left out of everything, he shares EC again. ‘Aliens above’ - When Aku and Nipper hear strange noises from upstairs, they decide an alien lives there. The older kids don’t believe it, so the two of them go to find out the truth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar, Steve Steve Jodrell and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: EC and the lift-off kids
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Amanda Smith, Steve Joddrell and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Three more adventures with EC. In “Scratch it” Nipper wants to be a grown up so he can do fun things with EC and his friends like camping, so the children decide to camp in the backyard. In “All together now” Nipper hurts his knee while playing in a vacant block. In “For sale” the children have turned an old warehouse into their own theatre, but find out that the warehouse is going to be sold.
